news_header: Uncertainties and allegations of fraud mar Mozambique's recent elections.
news_text: Electoral.rs reported that the recent parliamentary and presidential elections in Mozambique, held on October 9, were unclear, with the European Union's observers noting modifications to results at polling stations. Protests erupted in Maputo over alleged electoral fraud, leading to clashes with riot police. Two individuals were shot during the protests, prompting the United States to condemn the actions and call for an investigation. Official election results have yet to be announced.
